other_tests.findings: Gallbladder is distended with multiple gallstones; two calculi in the cystic duct measuring 6 mm and 8 mm. Fluid within the gallbladder wall and abnormal enhancement of the cystic duct and gallbladder wall. Restricted diffusion within the gallbladder wall and no intra or extrahepatic duct dilatation. Abnormal hyperenhancement of the left lobe of the liver and surrounding gallbladder on the arterial phase, with compression of the main portal vein, but it remains patent.
